channel.title: Making certain commands for admins to use

item.title: Making certain commands for admins to use
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

depends how they organized it. if there is no player right in the beginning of the command any1 can use it, if the player rights are 0 the any1 can use, playerrights == 1 ponly mods if it is >= then mods and up, if its <= 1, then mods and under,and 2 is admin and 3 is owner and 4 is hidden owner

Read full topic
item.source: Making certain commands for admins to use

item.title: Making certain commands for admins to use
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

I Vain I:

It doesn’t matter if it’s greater-than and equal-to. It was appending to all rights of 2 or higher. The standard Project Insanity sets administrators to the right of 2. This means the command is not pertaining to their rights for some reason. So, it’s mostly plausible that it’s the methods.

Ok, so, If I look then there is a method for mods and under all that is mod commands, then there is a method for admins and under all that is admin commands, then owner method and under that is owner commands? Is this right?

Read full topic
item.source: Making certain commands for admins to use

item.title: Making certain commands for admins to use
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Most Project Insanity servers separate the Commands class into methods appended by playerRights.

Simply make sure that command isn’t in the method that appends to ‘owners’ only.[/quote]

well its greater then or equal too, and this is sorta a beginner problem, so he might be getting confused with that, he will definitely get confused with this.

Read full topic

item.title: Making certain commands for admins to use
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerRights >= 1) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

                            } // HERE?
                            } // HERE?[/code]

to do that (the above one is done), all you have to do is find the player rights

at the very top
and change it to if it is >=
0 = mod, admin, owner, co-owner
1= admin, owner, co-owner
2 = owner, owner
there is no reg player
if it is ==
then
0 = reg, mod, admin, owner, co-owner
1= mod, admin, owner, co-owner
2 - admin, owner, co-owner
3 = owner, co-owner
if it is just > then its the same as the first set

Read full topic

item.title: Making certain commands for admins to use
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

Hello, I need to make these commands for admins to use. Atm they are owner only but I’m trying to make them for admins… I’m using a PI server and here is what the codes look like.

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerRights >= 2) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			} // HERE?
			} // HERE?[/code]

That is my item code and they all have && c.playerRights >= 2) { after them but it still is for owners only… anyone help?

Read full topic
